alert.note: Alert for Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 12 at 7:22PM EDT until August 12 at 7:45PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: The National Weather Service in Albany has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... South central Ulster County in east central New York... * Until 745 PM EDT. * At 721 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles east of Grahamsville to Woodridge to near Maplewood, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Ellenville, Kerhonkson, Napanoch, Wawarsing, Crawford, Port Ben, Cherrytown, Palentown, Sundown, Liebhardt, Fantinekill, Awosting, Dairyland, Granite, Ulsterville, Cragsmoor, Walker Valley, Mombaccus, Honk Hill and Greenfield Park. Please report hail size...damaging winds and reports of trees down to the National Weather Service by email at Alb.Stormreport@noaa.gov... On Facebook at www.facebook.com/nwsalbany or twitter @nwsalbany TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
